channel.title: 纽约时报-全球
channel.description: 这是一个追踪纽约时报-全球news的种子

item.title: 据华盛顿大都会警察局称，周日下午一名男子在以色列驻华盛顿大使馆外自焚，警方正在对附近一辆可疑车辆进行爆炸物调查。
item.description:
A man set himself on fire outside the Israeli Embassy in Washington on Sunday afternoon and police were investigating a suspicious nearby vehicle for explosives, according to the Metropolitan Police Department in Washington. https://t.co/3F3W3gHTZE

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 强奸、杀戮、酷刑：一份严酷的报告提供了新的证据，证明苏丹军方及其敌人准军事组织快速支援部队犯下了骇人听闻的暴行。
item.description:
Rape, killing, torture: A stark report offers new evidence of horrific abuses carried out by Sudan’s military and its enemy, the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces. https://t.co/D8s2tBxUlW

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 在拉丁美洲，男性往往比女性拥有更多的机会，尤其是在体育运动方面，据信这在拉丁美洲尚属首次。
item.description:
In what is believed to be a first in Latin America — a region where men often have more opportunities than women, particularly in sports — a professional women’s softball league has started in Mexico. https://t.co/LtAN8K7eex

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 以色列军方周日表示，他们已经结束了在加沙第二大医院纳赛尔医疗中心的行动，并在那里拘留了 200 人。
item.description:
The Israeli military said on Sunday that it had concluded its operation at Nasser Medical Complex, Gaza’s second-largest hospital, and had detained 200 people there. https://t.co/7eYjg58nXi

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 沙米玛-贝古姆（Shamima Begum）在 2015 年十几岁时与两个朋友从伦敦的家中前往叙利亚，加入了 "伊斯兰国 "恐怖组织。
item.description:
Shamima Begum, who traveled from her home in London to Syria with two friends in 2015 when she was a teenager to join the Islamic State terrorist group, has lost her latest bid to regain her British citizenship. https://t.co/Nm4BPaKWLR

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelensky）周日表示，自俄罗斯两年前开始全面入侵乌克兰以来，已有约 31,000 名乌克兰士兵丧生，这是乌克兰在这场战争中首次承认损失的具体数字。
item.description:
Some 31,000 Ukrainian soldiers have been killed since Russia’s full-scale invasion began two years ago, President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Sunday, acknowledging for the first time in the war a concrete figure for losses. https://t.co/Y2Pes5gfea

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 弗拉基米尔-利赫万（Vladimir Likhvan）逃离了俄罗斯对乌克兰的入侵，希望在欧洲找到安全的地方，但他只能无助地看着自己的新家在周四瓦伦西亚一座高层公寓大楼的大火中被烧毁，造成至少 10 人死亡。
item.description:
Vladimir Likhvan fled Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, hoping to find safety in Europe, only to watch helplessly as his new home was destroyed in a fire that raged Thursday through a high-rise apartment complex in Valencia, killing at least 10 people. https://t.co/z0Z61aWY91

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 联合国的一份新报告利用卫星图像、照片、视频和对 300 多名受害者的采访，生动详细地描述了苏丹内战不断升级的恐怖景象。
item.description:
The horrors of Sudan’s spiraling civil war are laid out in graphic detail in a new United Nations report that draws on satellite imagery, photos, videos and interviews with over 300 victims. https://t.co/8YvX7frRbl

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 在拉丁美洲，男性往往比女性拥有更多的机会，尤其是在体育运动方面，据信这在拉丁美洲尚属首次。
item.description:
In what is believed to be a first in Latin America — a region where men often have more opportunities than women, particularly in sports — a professional women’s softball league has started in Mexico. https://t.co/GpVCdUtqE1

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 伊利诺伊大学的生态学家兼教授吉姆-达林（Jim Dalling）说："这是世界上任何其他植物都不曾有过的现象。"他在巴拿马热带雨林中发现了一种树蕨根部萌发的所谓僵尸叶片。
item.description:
“This is completely unknown in any other plant in the world,” said Jim Dalling, an ecologist and professor at the University of Illinois who discovered the so-called zombie fronds sprouting roots of a tree fern in the Panamanian rainforest. https://t.co/qiygGycmB3

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 在与俄罗斯支持的分离主义分子爆发冲突十年后，莫斯科全面入侵乌克兰两年后，乌克兰人疲惫不堪，但始终决心击退入侵者。
item.description:
Ten years after the conflict with Russian-backed separatists broke out and two years into Moscow’s full-scale invasion, Ukrainians are weary but ever determined to repel the invaders. https://t.co/KkKeYwDeHG

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 这场战争已夺走了数十万人的生命，如今战争已进入第三年，华盛顿与基辅之间的情报合作关系是乌克兰自卫能力的关键所在。
item.description:
Now entering the third year of a war that has claimed hundreds of thousands of lives, the intelligence partnership between Washington and Kyiv is a linchpin of Ukraine’s ability to defend itself. https://t.co/xmMMDvramB

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: Yulia Selesnyova 知道她的儿子 Aleksei 在乌克兰东部的一次爆炸中丧生。但她还是在等他。
item.description:
Yulia Selesnyova knows that her son Aleksei was killed in a bombing in eastern Ukraine. She is waiting for him anyway. https://t.co/wxuZv4Br6U

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 哈马斯 10 月 7 日发动袭击后，像霍梅什这样的约旦河西岸定居点体现了以色列人思想的转变，因为在很久以前，以色列人与巴勒斯坦人的对话重点是两国解决方案。
item.description:
In the wake of the Oct. 7 Hamas attacks, West Bank settlements like Homesh embody a shift in thinking among Israelis since the days, seemingly ages ago, when dialogue with Palestinians focused on a two-state solution. https://t.co/dLO5RG838g

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 白俄罗斯举行了一次选举，结果早已注定：议会中充斥着专制统治者亚历山大-卢卡申科（Aleksandr G. Lukashenko）的支持者。
item.description:
Belarus holds an election with a pre-ordained result: a Parliament stacked with supporters of the authoritarian ruler, Aleksandr G. Lukashenko. https://t.co/MXJVRlsDW2

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 25, 2024

item.title: 俄罗斯入侵乌克兰两年后，美国有能力向基辅提供武器、技术和情报，以抵御莫斯科的接管。但现在欧洲各国都认为华盛顿已经失去了斗志。
item.description:
Two years after Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, the United States has the capacity to keep Kyiv supplied with the weapons, technology and intelligence to fend off a takeover by Moscow. But Washington is now perceived around Europe to have lost its will. https://t.co/YFqiBUa5ew

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 法国农民周六在埃马纽埃尔-马克龙总统抵达巴黎参加一年一度的农业展时向他发泄怒火。
item.description:
France’s farmers vented their fury at President Emmanuel Macron on Saturday as he arrived at the annual agricultural show in Paris, a giant fair long seen as a test of presidents’ relationship with the countryside. https://t.co/1t2mk9vbSO

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 随着资金涌入英格兰足球低级别联赛，即使是有钱的老板也越来越发现自己无法获得成功。通过 @RorySmith：
item.description:
As money pours into the lower leagues of English soccer, even rich owners are increasingly finding themselves priced out of success. Via @RorySmith: https://t.co/dX0iYFQnBA

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 这场大火造成至少 10 人死亡，许多乌克兰难民失去了家园，其他人则忙于重建家园。
item.description:
The fire that killed at least 10 people left many refugees from Ukraine without a home and others scrambling to rebuild their lives https://t.co/Ymfu0TFhOK

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 多伦多汽车失窃案频发，令许多居民恼羞成怒，一些人开始创造性地采取威慑措施，比如在住宅车道上安装护柱。
item.description:
An epidemic of auto thefts in Toronto has left many residents exasperated, with some getting creative about deterrence efforts, such as installing bollards in home driveways. https://t.co/440i4ddzw6

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 由于以色列的军事进攻，大多数加沙人被逼到了领土的一个小角落里，厕所的严重短缺造成了卫生危机，并导致疾病传播。
item.description:
With most Gazans pushed into a small corner of the territory by Israel’s military offensive, a severe shortage of toilets is posing a sanitation crisis that is spreading disease. https://t.co/qHcRjed3xf

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 美国官员花了数年时间调查贩毒集团与墨西哥总统盟友之间可能存在的联系。根据记录，这项调查最终不了了之。
item.description:
Funcionarios de EE. UU. pasaron años indagando posibles vínculos entre los cárteles de la droga y aliados del presidente de México. La indagatoria, al final, fue dejada de lado, según consta en los registros. https://t.co/4LhI7oqtsp

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 即时新闻：俄罗斯反对派领导人阿列克谢-纳瓦尔尼的女发言人说，他的遗体已归还给他的母亲，结束了他的遗体监护权争夺战。目前尚不清楚他是否会举行公众可以参加的葬礼。
item.description:
Breaking News: Aleksei Navalny’s body was returned to his mother, the Russian opposition leader’s spokeswoman said, ending a custody battle for his remains. It is unclear whether he will get a funeral that the public can attend. https://t.co/wQU2zod7p4

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 球迷和专家认为，韩国体育赛事中女性观众人数众多是由于韩国场馆的安全感。还有人说，韩国强烈的明星崇拜也是一个因素。
item.description:
Aficionados y expertos atribuyen la gran afluencia femenina en los eventos deportivos surcoreanos a la sensación de seguridad en los recintos del país. Otros dicen que influye el intenso culto nacional a las estrellas. https://t.co/ywNrtLOhMq

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 欧洲和其他西方国家领导人齐聚基辅，承诺在美国不情愿的情况下支持乌克兰，而乌克兰军队在战场上遭受的损失却越来越大，俄罗斯人在战场上节节胜利
item.description:
European and other Western leaders gathered in Kyiv to pledge support for Ukraine amid U.S. reluctance, while its troops suffer growing losses on the battlefield, where the Russians have been gaining ground https://t.co/nTn9MEuPJe

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 近两年过去了，只有零星的信息，一个乌克兰家庭仍然希望他们的儿子--一名在马里乌波尔被俄军俘虏的海军陆战队员--能早日回家。
item.description:
After nearly two years and only scraps of information, a Ukrainian family still hopes their son, a marine captured by the Russians in Mariupol, will come home soon. https://t.co/bdEhdCA90I

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 内塔尼亚胡发布了第一份战后加沙计划，但该建议激怒了阿拉伯国家，并遭到巴勒斯坦人的拒绝。
item.description:
Netanyahu issues first plan for post-war Gaza, but the proposal rankled Arab nations and was rejected by Palestinians. https://t.co/KB5E4SANyB

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024

item.title: 战争的第三年伊始，乌克兰领导人正试图在俄罗斯的猛烈进攻中找到一条新的前进道路，同时还要面对一系列令人生畏的未知因素。
item.description:
At the beginning of a third year of war, Ukraine’s leaders are trying to find a new path forward amid ferocious Russian assaults, while facing a series of daunting unknowns. https://t.co/hIzQHPGD0A

— New York Times World (@nytimesworld) February 24, 2024
